Key Match Events: The Celtics locked down Anthony Edwards, holding him to just 15 points on 5-16 from the field.
Pre-Game Insights: The Celtics knew they had to shut down Anthony Edwards, who averages 24.5 points this season.
Post-Match Reflections: Anthony Edwards vented his frustrations to the media, feeling like he had to pass the ball more than he wanted to due to the Celtics' defense.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Celtics won 118-115, taking down the Timberwolves and improving to 3-1 in their last four games.
Others: Jrue Holiday was tasked with guarding Edwards and did a phenomenal job, holding him to just 2-9 from the 3-point line.
